meanings.definition: A fixed regular payment, typically paid on a daily or weekly basis, made by an employer to an employee.
meanings.sent1: She received her weekly wage on Friday.
meanings.sent2: The company increased the hourly wage for all employees.
meanings.sent3: His wage was so small, he couldn't even buy a candy bar.
meanings.sent4: The wage he earned was a drop in the bucket compared to his expenses.
meanings.sent5: The wage he earned barely covered his rent, let alone other expenses.

meanings.sent1: The army decided to wage a fierce battle against the enemy.
meanings.sent2: They planned to wage a peaceful protest for their rights.
meanings.sent3: He wanted to wage war against the noisy neighbors playing loud music.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to wage a constant battle against procrastination.
meanings.sent5: The team was ready to wage a strategic campaign to win the championship.

meanings.sent1: The country chose to wage a diplomatic war instead of a military one.
meanings.sent2: They decided to wage a social media campaign to raise awareness.
meanings.sent3: He would often wage a friendly competition with his brother.
meanings.sent4: She felt the need to wage a personal battle against self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The students were eager to wage a debate on the topic of climate change.
